questions.question: Where was Ruth Bader Ginsburg from?

choices.answer: Moscow, Russia
London, England
Brooklyn, New York
Madison, Wisconsin

questions.question: Who/What gave Ruth the idea she could do big things in the world?

choices.answer: Her schools
Her parents
Her friends
Reading Books

questions.question: Growing up, what was one thing Ruth never forgot?

choices.answer: The sting of prejudice
Living in Russia
The stories she read
Her mother's words of encouragement

questions.question: What was Ruth's first act of protest?

choices.answer: Singing loudly even though she was bad at it.
She attended Law School after college.
She wrote with her left hand in Elementary school.
She rebelled against her father's ideals of being a women.

questions.question: When did Ruth have her first baby?

choices.answer: When she was in High school
During Law school
After she became a Lawyer
When she was in Undergraduate school.

questions.question: How many women were in her class during Law school.

choices.answer: 9 women out of 500 men
19 women out of 600 men
90 women out of 600 men
3 women out of 500 men

questions.question: What three strikes did Ruth have that made it difficult for her to be hired as a Lawyer?

choices.answer: She was selfish, lazy and untrustworthy
She was a woman, a mother, and Jewish
She was a woman, a grandma and a Russian
She was Kind, Caring and Trustworthy

questions.question: What Supreme Court decision did Ruth REALLY REALLY Disagree with?

choices.answer: That women shouldn't become artists.
That women shouldn't eat Ice Cream during the winter.
That men were too shy and weak to do big things.
That women have always been dependent on Men.

questions.question: As a lawyer, Ruth went to court to fight against...?

choices.answer: Racial Equality
Gender Equality
Religious Equality
Police Brutality

questions.question: What was one characteristic about Ruth's family that went against the norm?

choices.answer: The husband was the one who did the cooking.
The wife did all the home repairs.
The husband did the child rearing at home.
The husband did all the gardening.

questions.question: What life changing event happen to Ruth in 1993?

choices.answer: She won a hotdog eating competition in her hometown.
Her father passed away.
She became the first Jewish woman on the Supreme Court.
She became the first woman to work for the President.

questions.question: What was something special that Ruth did to show she disagreed or agreed to a Court Decision?

choices.answer: She changed the collar she wore over her robe.
Wrote to the president when she didn't agree to a decision.
She would take her glasses off to show agreement.
She changed the color of her robe to show her decision.

questions.question: Justice Ruth, changed the minds of congress and the president towards what important ruling?

choices.answer: The ruling for animal rights.
The ruling to increase the federal minimum wage.
The ruling to allow women to go to law school.
The ruling for women to get paid the same as men.

questions.question: Based on the life or Ruth Bader Ginsburg, what was the message of this book?

choices.answer: For people to dream big and chase their dreams.
To treat all animals with love and respect.
For people to be treated without prejudice.
That men could do anything women could do.

questions.question: What is the title of this book?

choices.answer: I DISSENT
I didn't pay attention to this presentation :(
I DISSAGREE
I forgot.
